metadata.Title: CVE-2014-7191 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description: The qs module before 1.0.0 in Node.js does not call the compact functionfor array data, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service(memory consumption) by using a large index value to create a sparse array.

criterions.comment: node-qs: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
